annotation.TEXT: That would be the pipe I initially went down, so back to the right I go. There might be a second hidden block here...
Fire Bars underwater? Sure, why not? Fiery Mario has no trouble shooting fireballs underwater, and there were also Fire Bars in the underwater section of 8-4 in the original game.
How about pipe number 4?
Alright, there's my 1-up, so I'm outta here!
In the meantime, I'll just murder a bunch of Bullet Bills up here since I've got nothing better to do. (How does one murder a bullet?)
Up next, let's go with a random Simon skin.
...As soon I can find Simon... Oh, yeah, he's up here. I guess the Whip Skeleton threw me off.
Yeah, I not only missed the 6, but I even failed to get 5000 from the flag. Darn.
Yes, it is! Although it sends me straight back to the first pipe from there, skipping the bonus room, which is fine, because that's where I wanted to be!
Oh, wait a minute here! I do believe I can do the same life-farming trick here that I did in 7-1 of the original SMB maps!

Also, in one of the recent updates (I think it was for version 3.1.2), a "Classic Special" option was added. If it's enabled, you can use up+attack for Simon's and Ryu's subweapons and down+attack for Sophia III's subweapons. If it's disabled, you have to use the special button to use those subweapons.
Nuts. Oh, well. It's not like my "S" would've been very helpful here anyway. Also, this pipe does indeed go somewhere.
Yes! I can now destroy Bullet Bills!
Aw, I was like "Oh, good!" when I saw that pipe, but I can't even enter it. Nuts!
Demo count: 8
Alright, max whip upgrade. Now give me a power up containing a good subweapon. The axe would be useful here.
Yeah, the goal's right there! Oh, speedrunners would love that pipe then. However, I didn't want to skip the whole level yet. Since there were bricks covering that pipe, is it two-way?
And it's two-way. Okay...
And we have another water level, which is not surprising, since this is 7-2. Hopefully there'll be a dry side room with a power up in here somewhere, just like with 2-2.
No, I don't want the machine gun, but I do want to check that pipe. Can I possibly avoid the "M" as I step up there?
Oh, what?! Okay, I was hit by Bowser's fire, but I should've grabbed onto the Fire Bar's ledge there, because that's how it works when the player is knocked into a wall in the NES Ninja Gaiden games!
Hmm... Which pipe should I take here?
First, enter pipe number 4. Then, immediately go back down pipe number alpha upon emerging.
Yep, there's the goal. Unfortunately, I haven't practiced the timing with Simon like I have with Bill, so...
Alright, so I rescued... Umm... Is that one of the thieves from Zozo? And, I guess Shadow is indeed looking for his dog. (I hope it didn't get Ripplered away by a Reach Frog!)
Ooh, it's Kunio from River City Ransom EX. I haven't ever used him yet.
Oh, swell. I missed a simple jump. No, I didn't forget about my double jump, but it just really looked like I'd make it with a single jump.
Oh, and here's that pipe I was just mentioning! How fortunate!
Too bad my AWESOME SPREAD GUN is useless on Bullet Bills and Buzzies, which I guess 7-1 has a lot of. Maybe I'll take the fire gun if it happens to show up.
Oh, please take me somewhere nice!

Yep, I figured there'd be a hidden block there. (But I doubt there are any hidden blocks to the right of the pipe, so that's why I didn't just jump down on that side and "wheel" the Hammer Bro. to death.)
Hopefully I got everything in here, but if I missed something, let me know!
Ooh, the game will let me enter the top entrance of the pipe this time. (It probably leads to the same place as the regular side entrance.)
To be continued...
Now, supposedly, world 7-4 is a nasty maze, so if that's true, I wouldn't be surprised if I ran out of time here. And I will not use the Infinite Time cheat to save myself this time if that happens.
Wow, little room for error on this jump, that's for sure.
STUPID CHEEPOS!!! I really wish I hadn't missed that jump the first time!
What about pipe number 3?
And, finally, we'll end world 7 with Shadow. (I wonder why Shadow keeps getting voted for... I mean, he's cool and all, but there are many other Ryu skins to pick from.)
And just like 2-3, it's got flying cheepos, right?
Seriously? That hit me? I swear those Bloopers are moving faster than they should be. And now I really hope there's a dry side area with power ups in it!
Demo count: 9
Well, fortunately, I took him out with no problem.
Oh, it's so gotta be pipe number Beryllium over there, but it's blocked by the DK fire enemies. (This is the first time we've seen those in this game.)
Alright, let's try the midair pipe, which is number Lithium. (Note: The upside-down pipe doesn't count towards my "numbering" theme.)
Now, let's try not to get knocked into the lava again, alright? At least I've got plenty of time remaining this time, so I won't feel compelled to rush.
Let me guess... There's an easier-to-reach pipe somewhere that sends you into the top portion of this bonus room, right?
Alright, the final world is up ahead! I don't know if I'll be doing the entire world in one video, but regardless, place your votes for who you guys want me to use!
Yep, and there's the time warning, but I've gotta be near the end by now, right?
Whoa, what the?
Or maybe there'll just be precision cloud jumps.
Ooh, hidden blocks.
Oh, brother. Why does Random keep picking Bill? Well, actually, it's Lance this time, which is good, because Lance needs some screen time too.
In this room, enter pipe number Lithium which is in midair, and then I'll be back where I was.
Demo count: 7
Okay, now maybe a cheepo ambush will be a little less deadly... Still, I don't want to get hit at all, obviously.
I figured there was a hidden block there, since not everyone can climb up walls.
Oh, wait. I just realized now as I'm annotating here that I was technically in a different room, since the enemies and the hidden coin block had reset. Doesn't actually matter now though.
Yeah, we've gotta have the flying Cheepos.
ZXCVBNM... Bake sale!
Okay, this is new. Oh, and I guess I can't approach from the bottom, so maybe I was supposed to go back into that pipe again.
Oh! Well, if I had known he was that close to dying, I would've just kept up with my shuriken attacks. But, whatever. I got him without taking a hit, so that's fine.
Umm... This could be tight. I might want to try getting into melee range here...
Looks like the end of the line. Maybe there'll be a power up or two up here?
Alright, that's a good sign, and so is the Bowser fire.
I really don't have time to check every brick now. In fact, I hope to find the pipe that'll lead me to the upper portion of that bonus room, so that I can quickly finish the level.
Yep. However, I'll destroy the shell and take off once I've gotten one 1-up.
Okay, I guess that Panser was a Sidestepper crab. When I first saw it, I thought for a split-second that it was gonna shoot fireballs at me, like in SMB2.
Sigh... There go all of the upgrades I had on Simon. And now these Cheepos could be deadlier than ever if I'm unlucky.
Oh, man. Time limit. I probably shouldn't have wasted time on that 1-up trick back there. Also, I figured there was a multi-coin block here, since this setup is just like in the original SMB's 7-1.
Oh, man. I can enter the very first pipe in the level to my left.
What is that, a wheel? ...Oh, it's the boomerang. Alright, that's not bad.
I also really wish that Google hadn't ruined YouTube, but it's not like that wish will ever come true...
Anyway, the alt. skin votes included Mario's or Luigi's SMB Special skin, and Shadow (Ryu), who seems to be popular for some reason. However, Random won, so that's what I'll start with.
That's a lot of Bloopers. Also, looks like Boos replace the fish with these ghost house graphics.
This room again? Well, at least the timer doesn't tick down during pipe transitions.
Yeah, I thought the flagpole would be right there. So, were there no power ups at all in 7-2? Or did I miss a hidden one during that cloud jumping segment there?
Let's try pipe number 4 again, and then immediately go back down pipe number alpha.
I've still got some time left, so let's backtrack... if I safely can... Oh, why am I even considering taking on that Hammer Brother?
Umm... Did pipe number B just take me to the exact same room again? Looks like it, so I'll take pipe number A back to start.
Pipe number 2 leads to the same room.
Whoa, I want out of here before a Cheepo gets me again!
Okay, I'll double jump here just to make sure I don't miss this time.
Back to square one. Oh, joy.
Alright, up next, I believe I'll go with one of the SMB Special skins for one of the Mario Bros., and since I've already used "jaundice" Luigi in the past, I'll go with "jaundice" Mario this time!
Oh, please tell me that's a power up and that I'm getting close to the end.

Hello, and welcome back to SMB Crossover! So, is there any truth to what I read somewhere about being able to disconnect my Google+ account from my YouTube account? And would this negatively affect anything if I were to do so?

Alright, let's get back there. I'm gonna take the route that I now know works. If there's other parts of the level containing goodies that I haven't encountered, forget them for now. (But, let me know if there are so that I can show them in an "and a half" episode.)
Hmm... So, where am I now? Who knows, but I'd better not break those bricks until that barrel goes away, since I can't destroy the barrel.
Oh, wait... I think they're from the All Night Nippon version of SMB.
Huh. This appears to be a split bonus room, and I happened to enter the more profitable portion, which has 9x as many coins.
Sweet! Got the 6! (I've been practicing the timing with Bill.)
Unfortunately, I can't destroy them (at least with what I have), and jumping past them flawlessly looks nearly impossible. ...Argh. This had so better be the right way to go...
Ah, there's an "F", which I'll take so that I can destroy Bullet Bills and Buzzies. Also, there's a 1-up in the other brick here, and... Am I right near the goal?
Alright, it's boss time, against Ganon again, and with Final Fantasy III NES battle music!
Votes for Google to change the comments back: At least 229,625.
Yikes, that was close.
Aw, for a second there I thought I might've been approaching Bowser. Well, where does pipe number beta take me?
GAAAMMMEEE!!! That pipe sent me back to the start of the room! So, Shadow got a second-degree burn for nothing!

Yes, this does mean I'm skipping like the second half of 7-1 here, but I don't want to keep abusing the Infinite Time cheat, so I'll just make an "and a half" episode later to show off the entirety of 7-1.
Okay, I'm somewhere new, and... What the heck?! Whose head is coming out of those pipes? I wonder what game they're from?
